title: APT / EMPTY ROOM DOOR
description: APARTMENT #10. A door leading to the apt with a real estate agent.

dialogueTree.title: Locked Door: "The door number #10 is closed again..."
dialogueTree.text: The door number #10 is closed again.

links.title: You: "Knock."
links.text: Knock.

links.title: Locked Door: "Nothing happens. The real estate ag..."
links.text: Nothing happens. The real estate agent must have left.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Locked Door: "You hear someone walking around ins..."
dialogueTree.text: You hear someone walking around inside, rearranging the furniture. The number on the panel says #10.

links.title: You: "Knock."
links.text: Knock.

links.title: Locked Door: "The walking stops abruptly, but no..."
links.text: The walking stops abruptly, but no one comes to the door.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You can feel tension on the other s..."
links.text: You can feel tension on the other side.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Sounded like a woman. A woman's sho..."
links.text: Sounded like a woman. A woman's shoes.

links.title: You: "Knock again."
links.text: Knock again.

links.title: Locked Door: "This time the steps come closer. "W..."
links.text: This time the steps come closer. "Who is this?" demands a female voice, wary and tense.

links.title: You: ""This is the police. Open up.""
links.text: "This is the police. Open up."

links.title: Locked Door: ""Do I *have to* open the door?" You..."
links.text: "Do I *have to* open the door?" You hear the clacking of heels again, as the other side walks right up to the door. Her tone is now getting a defensive edge...

links.title: Locked Door: ""Do you have a warrant? I'm not obl..."
links.text: "Do you have a warrant? I'm not obligated to open the door if you don't have a warrant."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go," the lieutenant says, "w..."
links.text: "Let's go," the lieutenant says, "we don't have a reason to get inside that apartment."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Later then. Entering this door seem..."
links.text: Later then. Entering this door seems a physical *challenge*.

links.title: Logic: "It's generally easier to do things..."
links.text: It's generally easier to do things if you have literally *any* reason.

links.title: You: ""This apartment is supposed to be e..."
links.text: "This apartment is supposed to be empty. Did you break in here?"

links.title: Locked Door: ""Excuse me? Of course not!""
links.text: "Excuse me? Of course not!"

links.title: Half Light: "Scare them. Suspected of some *big..."
links.text: Scare them. Suspected of some *big crime*!

links.title: Suggestion: "There's no sweet-talking your way i..."
links.text: There's no sweet-talking your way in there. Be official.

links.title: Logic: "You have *plenty* of reason to ente..."
links.text: You have *plenty* of reason to enter.

links.title: You: ""I don't need a warrant if I suspec..."
links.text: "I don't need a warrant if I suspect there's been a *break-in*."

links.title: Locked Door: ""Oh, come on!" There's a pause, bef..."
links.text: "Oh, come on!" There's a pause, before you hear the door being unlocked.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Well, that was easy."
links.text: Well, that was easy.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That was smart," the lieutenant sa..."
links.text: "That was smart," the lieutenant says, nodding toward the unlocked door.

links.title: You: ""Then open the door, so I can *veri..."
links.text: "Then open the door, so I can *verify* your identity."

links.title: You: ""Are you cooking *morphine* in ther..."
links.text: "Are you cooking *morphine* in there?!"

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
